verses.name: Proverbs 30:23
verses.text: For an odious woman when she is married; and an handmaid that is heir to her mistress.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:24
verses.text: There be four things which are little upon the earth, but they are exceeding wise:

verses.name: Proverbs 30:25
verses.text: The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;

verses.name: Proverbs 30:26
verses.text: The conies are but a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the rocks;

verses.name: Proverbs 30:27
verses.text: The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands;

verses.name: Proverbs 30:28
verses.text: The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings’ palaces.
